intro: Malvastrum buchtienii, commonly known as the Namib Desert mallow, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Namibia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and broad, lobed leaves adapted to reduce water loss. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in sandy soils and is well-suited to extreme environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
